pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.11: The nuns’ offenses entailing relinquishment 13–30 are identical, except for appropriate gender changes, to the monks’ relinquishment offenses as follows: Bi NP 13–15 = Bu NP 1–3 at Bu NP 1:2.17.1, Bu NP 2:2.39.1, and Bu NP 3:1.3.13.1; Bi NP 16–20 = Bu NP 6–10 at Bu NP 6:2.18.1, Bu NP 7:1.31.1, Bu NP 8:1.1.32.1, Bu NP 9:1.36.1, and Bu NP 10:1.3.1; Bi NP 21–23 = Bu NP 18–20 at Bu NP 18:1.28.1, Bu NP 19:1.15.1, and Bu NP 20:1.35.1; Bi NP 24–25 = Bu NP 22–23 at Bu NP 22:1.3.17.1 and Bu NP 23:1.3.32.1; Bi NP 26–29 = Bu NP 25–28 at Bu NP 25:1.27.1, Bu NP 26:1.23.1, Bu NP 27:1.45.1, and Bu NP 28:1.2.19.1; Bi NP 30 = Bu NP 30 at Bu NP 30:1.27.1.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.14: Before this summary line, the Pali reads (Dutiya) Pattavagga, “the (second) subchapter on almsbowls”, to indicate the last subchapter of nissaggiya pācittiya rules for the nuns, and then Pariṇatasikkhāpada, “the training rule on diverting an offering intended for the Sangha”, to indicate the last rule in the chapter of nissaggiya pācittiya rules. These indications are redundant in the present translation, since I have just pointed out all the missing rules and their equivalents in the bhikkhu-vibhaṅga.
